translation: ogłupić [humorous; to make someone feel confused and unable to think clearly]
sentence: I think my brain's been addled by the heat!

translation: łagodzić [to make something bad such as pain or problems less severe]
sentence: The drugs did nothing to alleviate her pain.

translation: nie w porządku, źle [wrong, not suitable, or not as expected]
sentence: I could see by the look on their faces that something was amiss.

translation: poddasze [the space or room at the top of a building, under the roof, often used for storing things]
sentence: I've got boxes of old clothes in the attic.

translation: aleja [a wide road with trees or tall buildings on both sides, or a wide country path or road with trees on both sides]
sentence: Michigan Avenue in Chicago is famous for its elegant stores.

translation: próba [an attempt to achieve something]
sentence: The council has banned cars from the city centre in a bid to reduce pollution.

translation: czoło [literary; the front part of your head between your eyes and your hair]
sentence: He wiped the sweat from his brow.

translation: koteria, klika [disapproving; a small group of people who plan secretly to take action, especially political action]
sentence: He was assassinated by a cabal of aides within his own regime.

translation: zwęglić [to burn and become black or to burn something so that it becomes black]
sentence: Grill the peppers until the skin starts to char.

translation: wyborowy [(especially of food) of very good quality]
sentence: I had the the most expensive dish on the menu - a choice fillet of fish.

translation: nieodparta chęć, przymus [a very strong feeling of wanting to do something repeatedly that is difficult to control]
sentence: I seem to have a constant compulsion to eat.

translation: hol, hala [a large, open part of a public building, especially an airport or a train station]
sentence: There's a ticket machine in the main concourse.

translation: rekonwalescencja [the period of time when you rest and get better after a serious illness]
sentence: You need four to six weeks' convalescence.

translation: wywoływać niezadowolenie [formal; to cause someone to be annoyed or unhappy]
sentence: The tone of the letter displeased her.

translation: rozdęty [swollen and large in a way that is not normal, especially because of pressure from inside]
sentence: The television showed images of starving children with distended bellies.

translation: przywdziewać [formal; to put on a piece of clothing]
sentence: He donned his finest coat and hat.

translation: posag [in some societies, an amount of money or property that a woman's parents give to the man she marries]
sentence: The dowry was never paid, and the king held himself free of his promise.

translation: oniemiały [unable to speak because of surprise]
sentence: The news left her dumbfounded.

translation: sprawa do załatwienia [a short journey either to take a message or to take or collect something]
sentence: I'll meet you at six, I've got some errands to run first.

translation: ekshumować [formal; to remove a dead body from the ground after it has been buried]
sentence: The body was exhumed on the order of the judge.

translation: strach, przerażenie [the feeling of fear, especially if felt suddenly, or an experience of fear that happens suddenly]
sentence: You gave her such a fright turning the lights out like that.

translation: bruzda [a long, narrow cut in the ground, especially one made by a plow for planting seeds in; a deep line in the skin of the face]
sentence: Years of anxiety have lined her brow with deep furrows.

translation: wichura [an extremely strong wind]
sentence: The gale blew down hundreds of trees.

translation: hasać, brykać [literary; to run and jump in a happy way]
sentence: Lambs were gambolling about in the spring sunshine.

translation: ozdobić, przybrać [to decorate food with a small amount of different food]
sentence: Garnish the dish with parsley before serving.

translation: chichotać [to laugh repeatedly in a quiet but uncontrolled way, often at something silly or rude or when you are nervous]
sentence: Stop that giggling in the back row!

translation: wielki, dostojny [impressive and large or important]
sentence: His job has a grand title, but he's little more than a clerk.

translation: harfa [a large, wooden musical instrument with many strings that you play with the fingers]
sentence: He took off its cloth covering, and the harp gave out a jarring sound.

translation: żywopłot [a row of bushes or small trees planted close together, usually along the edge of a field, yard, or road]
sentence: She kicked the ball so powerfully that it flew over the hedge.

translation: haniebny [formal; (esp. of a crime) extremely bad or evil]
sentence: In the enlightened 18th century popular fanaticism made of sacrilege the most heinous offence.

translation: kuśtykać [to walk in an awkward way, usually because the feet or legs are injured]
sentence: Some of the runners could only manage to hobble over the finishing line.

translation: szerszeń [a large flying insect that can give a severe sting]
sentence: It made Janet as mad as a hornet, but Martha's back in the classroom.

translation: monotonny, nudny [having no excitement, interest, or new and different events]
sentence: Most of the work is fairly humdrum.

translation: pokora [the quality of not thinking that you are better than other people; the quality of being humble]
sentence: He doesn't have the humility to admit when he's wrong.

translation: nieubłagany, nieuchronny [formal; continuing without any possibility of being stopped]
sentence: Aging is an inexorable process.

translation: naruszenie, pogwałcenie prawa [formal; an occasion when someone breaks a rule or law]
sentence: Any attempt to influence the judges will be seen as an infraction of the rules.

translation: nieodgadniony, niepojęty [not showing emotions or thoughts and therefore very difficult to understand or get to know]
sentence: He believes that a certain portion of life must remain inscrutable.

translation: nieuchwytny [impossible to touch, to describe exactly, or to give an exact value]
sentence: She has that intangible quality which you might call charisma.

translation: gniew [formal; anger]
sentence: The team drew the ire of local politicians when it moved to a new stadium outside the city.

translation: potrząsać, szarpać [informal; to move from side to side or up and down with quick short movements, or to make something do this]
sentence: If the door won't open, try jiggling the key in the lock.

translation: bez [a bush or small tree with sweet-smelling purple or white flowers]
sentence: The lilacs are in bloom.

translation: środek [formal; the middle of a group of people or things]
sentence: Such beauty was unexpected in the midst of the city.

translation: rzucający się w oczy, uciążliwy [noticeable in an unpleasant way]
sentence: The logo was still visible but less obtrusive this time in beige.

translation: zatykać, zablokować [specialized; to block something]
sentence: Veins can get occluded by blood clots.

translation: wredny, kłótliwy [informal; likely to get angry and argue with people]
sentence: He had been in an ornery mood all day, arguing with everyone who got in his way.

translation: pozornie, na zewnątrz [in a way that relates to how people, situations, or things seem to be, rather than how they are inside]
sentence: The men led outwardly normal lives as fathers and husbands.

translation: obłok, chmura [a thick, dark cloud of smoke]
sentence: Palls of smoke obscured our view.

translation: półmisek, taca [a large plate used for serving food or a meal with one type of food served on a large plate]
sentence: I cut the apples into pieces and put them on a platter.

translation: stanowisko, posada [formal; an important job, especially one in government]
sentence: She was offered a key post in the new government.She was offered a key post in the new government.

translation: sakiewka, torebka [a bag or soft container for a small object or a small amount of something]
sentence: All our electric shavers are supplied with a free travel pouch.

translation: wykluczać, uniemożliwiać [formal; to prevent something or make it impossible, or prevent someone from doing something]
sentence: His contract precludes him from discussing his work with anyone outside the company.

translation: rabin [a religious leader and teacher in the Jewish religion]
sentence: His early education was cared for by his father and by the local rabbi, David Frankel.

translation: stóg, sterta [a large pile of straw or hay that has been built in a regular shape]
sentence: In summer months the siren can be heard almost daily as hay barns and hay ricks catch fire.

translation: wciągający, fascynujący [approving; so interesting or exciting that it holds your attention completely]
sentence: I found the film absolutely riveting.

translation: lipa, fałszywka, oszust [something that is not what it seems to be and is intended to deceive people, or someone who pretends to be something they are not]
sentence: It turned out that he wasn't a real doctor at all - he was just a sham.

translation: połysk [approving; a smooth shine or brightness]
sentence: The conditioner gives hair a beautiful soft sheen.

translation: brać na siebie winę/ciężar/odpowiedzialność [to accept the responsibility for something]
sentence: Teachers cannot be expected to shoulder all the blame for poor exam results.

translation: nieświeży, czerstwy [no longer new or fresh, usually as a result of being kept for too long]
sentence: The morning after the party, their apartment smelled of stale cigarette smoke.

translation: gulasz [a type of food consisting usually of meat or fish and vegetables cooked slowly in a small amount of liquid]
sentence: She prepared a hearty stew for dinner.

translation: przedmieścia [an area on the edge of a large town or city where people who work in the town or city often live]
sentence: We drove from middle-class suburbs to a very poor inner-city area.

translation: wyniosły, lekceważący [disapproving; behaving as if you are better than other people, and that their opinions, beliefs, or ideas are not important]
sentence: He spoke in a haughty, supercilious voice.

translation: stringi [a pair of women's panties or men's underpants, or the bottom part of a bikini, that has only a very narrow strip of cloth, like a string, at the back]
sentence: I had on a hot pink halter top with a pink strapless bra and my really short black skirt with a pink thong.

translation: sparaliżowany, skamieniały [literary; unable to move or stop looking at something because you are so interested, surprised, or frightened]
sentence: Rabbits transfixed in the glare of car headlights are common victims on the roads. We all sat in silence, transfixed by what we saw on the screen.

translation: koryto [a long, narrow container without a lid that usually holds water or food for farm animals]
sentence: Turning on the water, she filled their water trough before heading out for the longhorn shed, which was the closest to the trees.

translation: czesne [money that you pay for being taught, especially at college or university]
sentence: Few can afford the tuition of $12,000 a semester.

translation: jednostronny [done by one member of a group or an organization without the agreement of the other members]
sentence: Opponents of the government have criticized the president's unilateral approach and believe broader international alliances are required.

translation: rozwiązać, rozwikłać [to explain something that is difficult to understand or is mysterious; to become clearer or easier to understand]
sentence: The discovery will help scientists unravel the mystery of the Ice Age.

translation: przewrót, wstrząs [a great change, especially causing or involving much difficulty, activity, or trouble]
sentence: Yesterday's coup brought further upheaval to a country already struggling with famine.

translation: wierzba
sentence: The willow and orchard trees - apple, pear, plum and cherry - are cultivated everywhere.

translation: widmo [literary; a spirit of a dead person, sometimes represented as a pale, transparent image of that person; something that is pale or weak and without a clear shape]
sentence: He watched the misty wraiths of moisture making patterns on the window pane.
